data.title: Possibly in the top 10 WORST!
data.text: Nothing good about the food and only thing worse than food was service. Just worst I've been to in months. Mickey D's would have been a better choice. Avoid at all costs!

data.title: Good food in the west
data.text:
We went dining out there last night.
The inside place looks like a wild west restaurant,  we loved the decor for sure.
What we ordered was very good.
My wife first had fried zucchinis and she liked it very much.
Then she ate an half rack of pork Ribs with a thick bbq sauce, we'll cooked and delicious. Ribs came wit baked potato and veggies. 
I had homemade onion rings and it was great, following by chicken marsala delicious and tasty.
Not for a romantic experience cause it might be a bit noisy due to the small size of the dining room.
They also have a bar.
We'll come back and try another meal.
The staff is nice and friendly too.

data.title: Old Restaurant I Couldn't Afford
data.text:
Forty-five years ago, only the rich country folk could afford this place. That's why we went there for lunch. Waiting for relatives to get their stuff together, we decided to break my dad's taboo and find out what it was about. It was about forty bucks for lunch.

The steak and eggs were as wonderful as it should be, and the wife was pleased with her chicken plate. The service wasn't perfect, but there was an air of superiority in the place that demonstrated their absolute faith that their food didn't stink. 

I've eaten better and cheaper, but never at the same time. Got to admit  it was a slight letdown to finally be inside, but the grub was very tasty, the decor was wagon wheel chic, and the waitress was highly adequate.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: After reading all the rave reviews, I bought a Groupon coupon and went for Sat. lunch.  Husband had the prime rib sandwich.  Ordered it medium rare, and it looked and tasted liked well done pot roast..  I had the liver and onions.   Large portion, but overcooked.  Maybe it was just a bad day.  Our waiter was very good, but not the food.

data.title: A romantic meal
data.text: I enjoyed eating at the Ranch I live about 75 miles away, I met up with a Lady friend for dinner. I had the Liver and onions with a green salad and a glass of wine, my date choose the Raviolis and a salad for dessert ice cream. I must say the food was delicious. They also offer steak Rib eye, Porter house etc. they have a nice menu, wine selection and a full bar.

data.title: We are officially regulars, and this is a great place!
data.text: We come here for all "sibling get-togethers" (four birthdays and Christmas, at least), never had a bad experience!  It seems a little dark inside when you first come in, but they've got a nice dining room just beyond that sports bar (and if you like sports bars, they've got a nice, cozy one where you can get good food too).  Also a banquet room, if you're having a private event.  The wait staff is GREAT, lots of good choices on the menu, and the prices are very reasonable.  We enjoy every visit.  OH - they're closed on Sundays.  Rather important point.

data.title: Diner fare in rustic setting
data.text:
Good food, reasonably priced, good and efficient service.
Stopped here for a late dinner after reading other reviews on tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed: Jack Daniel's glazed steak (ordered med-rare, turned out to be a bit on the medium side, still juicy and very tasty, though) and Cobb Salad, both good sized portions.

data.title: They welcome you like a regular
data.text: First time there and they treated me like I was party of the crew!  The bartenders rock and it has a very cool vibe there!  You could spend hours looking at de orations on the walls too.  Great place to grab a drink or a bite to eat....

data.title: A Wonderful Blast from the Past
data.text: Growing up in this part of the country, The Ranch was a favorite stop for an affordable family meal. Granted we had a family of 6 kids at the time growing up in the early 70s, we always looked forward to coming here for a weekend lunch. This was my first time back in nearly 40 years and it still has the magic. The staff is different of course but the liver and onions that what my wife had still fascinates. I opted for the Philly Cheese Steak plate. Don’t worry Pat’s got nothing to worry about. This wasn’t on the menu decades ago but I give The Ranch an A for effort. It was great to be back. I’d like to return for a cocktail or two – it has an awesome bar and plenty big screens to watch sports. Highly recommended. Family friendly. Plenty of parking. Check it out.

data.title: We're Regulars Here!
data.text: We live nearby and usually come in for breakfast - this is the only place to get a Ramos Fizz, and they know how to make them.  The crew here is old school, the food is quite good, and the bartenders offer a healthy pour; we've been eating here for years, and everyone is very friendly - staff and patrons alike.  There's a good selection of Italian, plus some Greek and regular American, with nice fresh fish and various specials, plus yummy desserts.  Decor here is really interesting as well - lots of home grown nostalgia, antiques, collectibles, and sports (fun to watch games).  You can eat any meal of the day and get a nice serving, with good variety and tasty stuff on the menu; the place is also family friendly.  We can always recommend the Ranch to eat, drink, and be merry!

data.title: Eclectic Atmosphere
data.text: Good fresh food at a reasonable price. I had the Cobb Salad which I took half home for dinner. Breakfast available if you choose it for lunch.

data.title: Best restaurant for the money in Hayward
data.text: Friendly fast service and good tasting food. Selections are somewhat limited, but I have never been disappointed . Been a customer for over 30 years.

data.title: Hayward Ranch restaurant
data.text:
The Hayward Ranch restaurant 22877 Mission Blvd Hayward early bird 10OZ steak dinner $17.95 Just now
Harry Stonelake from Palomares Hills Central
Our favorite steak restaurant is: The Hayward Ranch restaurant 22877 Mission Blvd Hayward early bird (before 6PM) 10OZ grilled steak dinner $17.95; huge salad on a chilled plate, hot bread, perfectly cooked steak and double vegetables instead of the baked potato, AND A FREE GLASS OF THE HOUSE RED OR WHITE. 

WE RECENTLY LEFT MY WIFES PURSE THERE, THEY FOUND IT AND PUT IT IN THE SAFE, WHEN WE CALLED THEY TOLD US THEY HAD IT AND IT WAS SAFE. WHEN WE PICKED IT UP EVERYTHING WAS IN IT. AND THAT'S ANOTHER REASON WE HAVE BEEN GOING THERE FOR OVER 30 YEARS.

data.title: A Hayward Institution
data.text: The Ranch has been around for decades.  I've lived in Hayward for 55 years and I don't remember a time without the Ranch.  They food has never changed.  I had lunch there a while back, and is par for the course, it was delicious.  Good food, good service and reasonable.  I recommend The Ranch.

data.title: Cool Eating Place
data.text: The service is always friendly and accommodating. I have seen them deal with questionable patrons in a very professional manner. I love going for happy hour because the bartender is AWESOME!

data.title: Hard Times Fall on Hayward Ranch
data.text:
My most recent trip to The Ranch disappointed. The food remains decent, but the place has gotten terribly dirty. Carpets are filthy. There's a layer of film on everything. It didn't feel very welcoming to our family. Service was OK, but on the verge of disgruntled. There are people drinking at the bar in one part of the place from the mid-morning on. Bathrooms are gross. 
It's a convenient gathering place for locals, but honestly I think it's becoming more like a dive bar than a restaurant. 
And it's no bargain. 
Skip it.

data.title: Good but needs updating
data.text: Service and food is good but the carpets are filthy and the wonderful collection of memorabilia is in a serious need of dusting. The Bar had the charm of what it pertains to be - a homely ranch setting! However, when a restaurant shows signs of neglect one wonders what the state of the kitchens might be!!! That detracts from the food! I hope the owners take this kindly advice and consider a 'makeover'

data.title: Long time establishment
data.text: I've seen the Hayward Ranch all my life and never had a chance to eat there. Finally stopped for dinner with a friend. They served up a GREAT Manhattan to start things off. The New York steak I had was ok but nothing special. It was served with corn that was a little on the tough side. The baked potato was good and the waiter brought butter for it right away. He asked if I wanted sour cream and bacon and I said yes. It was about 15 minutes later before I got the sour cream....? Not sure want happened with that as they weren't very busy. All in all it was ok. I'll probably go back at some point but it won't be my first choice for dinning.

data.title: Time capsule dining
data.text: We really don't like eating at clone chain restaurants, so when we saw this funky Western looking joint with a cattle head sign, it looked like a winner for we three. Ate at 11 but were in the mood for breakfast. Three selections: the Hayward Omelet with country potatoes, the East Bay omelet with shrimp and avocado, and pork chops with three sunny side up eggs and country potatoes.  Selection of breads was on top of that.  Served in a funky Western decor restaurant with an attached and active bar- it was tempting to consider a mimosa or Bloody Mary.  Servings were so large I thought I reliving previous night's Man vs Food episode. Good coffee. Served hot as a breakfast should be, I didn't feel like it was left sitting up waiting for the waitress.  Attentive service.  Exactly what we were looking for.

data.title: Don't talk bad about your customers or staff.
data.text: Well, I gave this place on last try. Came for breakfast. The cook can't make county potato to save his life. Over cook,dry and no taste and then had the nerve to talk bad about Dave(the chef here for years). The waitress cursed and talk bad about one of the customers that had a complaint about his butter on his toast. What's so sad she didn't care about myself and the other customer hearing it! She nice to us but I wonder if she will complain about us too?! The food is so much better when Dave is here! Diggers from now on!
